Pump.definition: A pump is a device which imparts mechanical work on fluids or slurries to move them through a channel or pipeline. A typical use of a pump is to circulate chilled water or heating hot water in a building services distribution system.

BiomassBoiler.definition: Boiler for the combustion of biomass fuels.

Fan.definition: A fan is a device which imparts mechanical work on a gas. A typical usage of a fan is to induce airflow in a building services air distribution system.

Space.definition: A space represents an area or volume bounded actually or theoretically. Spaces are areas or volumes that provide for certain functions within a building.

name.definition: Name of the element in the ifc file.

Element.definition: Links a Zone to an Element that is contained in, or adjacent to, the Zone.

minOccupants.definition: Minimum number of occupants inside a building.

ObXMLFile.definition: Relationship to indicate the path of the obXML file for an specific space.

maxOccupants.definition: Maximum number of occupants inside a building.

ifcIdentifier.definition: Identifier used in the IFC model (Global Unique ID).

FlowSegment.definition: Defines the occurrence of a segment of a flow distribution system.

PipeSegment.definition: A pipe segment is used to typically join two sections of a piping network.

HeatExchanger.definition: A heat exchanger is a device used to provide heat transfer between non-mixing media such as plate and shell and tube heat exchangers.

Apartment.definition: An apartment is a group of spaces, partial spaces or other zones.

Storey.definition: Relation to storeys contained in a zone.

containsZone.definition: Relationship to the subzones of a major zone. A space zone could for instance be contained in a storey zone which is further contained in a building zone.

Zone.definition: A part of the physical world or a virtual world that is inherently both located in this world and having a 3D spatial extent. Concept from the BOT ontology.

Storey.definition: Relation to storeys contained in a zone.

containsZone.definition: Relationship to the subzones of a major zone. A space zone could for instance be contained in a storey zone which is further contained in a building zone.

Space.definition: Relation to spaces contained in a zone.

Storey.definition: A level part of a building. Concept from the BOT ontology.

Apartment.definition: Relation between a storey and the apartments it is composed of.

Wall.definition: The wall represents a vertical construction that bounds or subdivides spaces. Wall are usually vertical, or nearly vertical, planar elements, often designed to bear structural loads. A wall is however not required to be load bearing.

SwitchingDevice.definition: A switch is used in a cable distribution system (electrical circuit) to control or modulate the flow of electricity.

EnergyConversionDevice.definition: Defines the occurrence of a device used to perform energy conversion or heat transfer and typically participates in a flow distribution system.

Outlet.definition: An outlet is a device installed at a point to receive one or more inserted plugs for electrical power or communications.

Building.definition: An independent unit of the built environment with a characteristic spatial structure. Concept from the BOT ontology.

Storey.definition: Relation to storeys contained in a zone.

buildingAddress.definition: The postal address of the building

SpaceHeater.definition: Space heaters utilize a combination of radiation and/or natural convection using a heating source such as electricity, steam or hot water to heat a limited space or area. Examples of space heaters include radiators, convectors, baseboard and finned-tube heaters.

Slab.definition: A slab is a component of the construction that normally encloses a space vertically. The slab may provide the lower support (floor) or upper construction (roof slab) in any space in a building.

BuildingElement.definition: The building element comprises all elements that are primarily part of the construction of a building, i.e., its structural and space separating system. Building elements are all physically existent and tangible things.

SolarDevice.definition: A solar device converts solar radiation into other energy such as electric current or thermal energy.

Door.definition: The door is a building element that is predominately used to provide controlled access for people and goods. It includes constructions with hinged, pivoted, sliding, and additionally revolving and folding operations. A door consists of a lining and one or several panels.

FlowTerminal.definition: Defines the occurrence of a permanently attached element that acts as a terminus or beginning of a distribution system (such as an air outlet, drain, water closet, or sink). A terminal is typically a point at which a system interfaces with an external environment.

Boiler.definition: A boiler is a closed, pressure-rated vessel in which water or other fluid is heated using an energy source such as natural gas, heating oil, or electricity. The fluid in the vessel is then circulated out of the boiler for use in various processes or heating applications.

Tank.definition: A tank is a vessel or container in which a fluid or gas is stored for later use.

FlowController.definition: Defines the occurrence of elements of a distribution system that are used to regulate flow through a distribution system. Examples include dampers, valves, switches, and relays.

Roof.definition: A roof is the covering of the top part of a building, it protects the building against the effects of wheather.

DistributionFlowDevice.definition: Defines occurrence elements of a distribution system that facilitate the distribution of energy or matter, such as air, water or power.

TubeBundle.definition: A tube bundle is a device consisting of tubes and bundles of tubes used for heat transfer and contained typically within other energy conversion devices, such as a chiller or coil.

identifierInDatabase.definition: Indicates the ID of the building element in the BIMERR materials and component database.

description.definition: Description of the element in the ifc file.

Window.definition: The window is a building element that is predominately used to provide natural light and fresh air. It includes vertical opening but also horizontal opening such as skylights or light domes. It includes constructions with swinging, pivoting, sliding, or revolving panels and fixed panels. A window consists of a lining and one or several panels.

FlowMovingDevice.definition: Defines the occurrence of an apparatus used to distribute, circulate or perform conveyance of fluids, including liquids and gases (such as a pump or fan), and typically participates in a flow distribution system.
